page.title: 10LANEHEAD
page.content: Lanehead is a hamlet which used to have a thriving shop and post office before the motor car gave easier access to towns and cheaper supermarkets. Today there are 15 dwellings-11 detached and 2 sets of two linked. The occupants of these are as follows: 3:working families with children 5: " " w/o " 5:retired people 2:holiday homes There is a workshop where frames are made for a timber frame house building business now based in Hexham. The old chapel, built in 1902, has been converted to a dwelling house. The stone for the chapel, some of the houses and the dry-stone walls was taken from the new disused quarry on the opposite side of the road from the chapel.
